basics.name: Cristian Esteban Perrone
basics.label: Frontend Developer
summary: As a Frontend Developer, I am committed to delivering high performance and creativity in my work. Being self-taught, I continuously stay updated on the latest web development technologies and engage in regular practice. My expertise is centered on web technologies, allowing me to immerse myself in three key areas that I am passionate about: Technology, Programming, and Design.

work.name: Dedalord Games
work.summary: I am currently working at this game company for a startup based in the United States. My role involves building a disruptive gaming platform powered by AI. As a Full-stack Developer, I contribute to the team by developing the web interface of this platform. The frontend is built with React, while the backend utilizes Node.js, PostgreSQL, and REST APIs.
highlights: Contributing to the development of an AI-powered gaming platform.

work.name: EPIC iO Technologies
work.summary: During my tenure at EPIC iO, I played multiple key roles, including the successful migration of applications such as the Camera CRUD app and Scene Creator to a new platform leveraging modern technologies like ReactJS, Redux, and SingleSPA. Additionally, I implemented a drawing application using the KonvaJS library to enhance user interaction and feedback in an image recognition AI system. I also designed and developed an API Gateway using GraphQL to integrate with RESTful APIs. To address business and migration needs, I conducted research and successfully implemented a microfrontend architecture based on SingleSPA, along with a monorepo structure. Furthermore, I developed a private library as an adapter for integrating new features and widgets into existing applications like Scene Creator and Camera Viewer.
highlights: Led the migration of key applications to modern technologies.

work.name: Webee Corporation
work.summary: At Webee, an Internet of Things (IoT) startup with bases in Silicon Valley and Córdoba, my team and I developed a MEAN-based platform focused on integrating a variety of devices and sensors. The platform connected these devices to a cloud infrastructure that processed data and presented it through custom user dashboards, designed using a Flow-Based Programming approach.
highlights: Developed an IoT platform integrating diverse sensors and devices.

work.name: Incluit
work.summary: As a Frontend Developer, I contributed to a project for Intel and McAfee at H+A Offices. Our team developed a security application that allowed McAfee customers to monitor potential security threats. The frontend was built using Angular Components, Redux (with Redux Saga), ES6 JavaScript, and Webpack. Additionally, I took on the role of QA Test Automation to ensure the quality of my own code.
highlights: Developed and tested frontend components for a security monitoring application.
